column4: Integrate with the ERP fleet management function to obtain information on vehicles, maintenance equipment and other fleet units  utilized in performing maintenance work activities.
Store and display fleet/equipment class name and code.
Store and display fleet/equipment type name and code.
Store and display fleet/equipment unit ID number.
Store and display manufacturer.
Store and display make.
Store and display model.
Store and display serial number.
Store and display USDOT number.
Store and display assigned organization.
Store and display current location of equipment.
Store and display prior history of equipment assignment.
Store and display warranty information and any recall history.
Store and display repair history.
Store and display history of equipment utilization.
Store and display eligibility of the equipment to be pooled.
Store and display current equipment status (Active, Pooled, Reserved, Under Repair, Scheduled for Maintenance, etc.).
Store and display combined current equipment status of equipment units which are needed to be reserved as a unit; for example  a loader and hauler.
Store and display skills/certifications required by operator.
Store and display rental rate, cost per hour or cost per mile (for activity costing purposes).
Utilize available fleet/equipment information to compare needed versus actual equipment, costing of work orders and daily work  accomplishments, and tracking condition and replacement needs.
Integrate with the ERP fleet management function to allow an authorized user to reserve equipment which is eligible to be pooled  and reflect the reserved equipment in their crew schedules.
Calculate automatically equipment utilization and non-productive (commitment time) equipment hours by type of equipment,  based on data input from crew leader's DARs on equipment usage.
Allow an authorized user to create minimum usage requirements for specified equipment that will be set as a threshold for  comparing planned usage versus actual usage.
